snippet: The 7-year-old, who suffered injuries to her brain, lungs and pelvis, had ingested cannabis, methadone and amphetamines before her plunge from a window in Coney Island.
abstract: Person with knowledge of investigation of how 7-year-old girl plunged six stories from the window of a Brooklyn apartment building says she had drugs in her system, including cannabis, methadone and amphetamines; no arrests have been made in case, but the girl and a 1-year-old also in the care of Diana Metellus, the girl's stepmother, have been remanded into care of New York City Administration for Children's Services.
lead_paragraph: The 7-year-old, who suffered injuries to her brain, lungs and pelvis, had ingested cannabis, methadone and amphetamines before her plunge from a window in Coney Island.

headline.main: Drugs Said to Be in System of Girl Who Fell Six Stories
headline.print_headline: Drugs Said to Be in System of Girl Who Fell Six Stories From Window in Brooklyn
